site.name: periodhub.health
site.title: periodhub.health - Your Guide to Menstrual Wellness
site.description: Your compassionate guide to navigating menstrual pain with effective solutions, supportive resources, and a path to better menstrual health.

hero.headline: Find Relief, Understand Your Cycle.
hero.subheadline: Your compassionate guide to navigating menstrual pain with effective solutions and supportive resources.
hero.bodyCopy: Welcome to periodhub.health ‚Äì your trusted partner for menstrual wellness. We offer evidence-based insights, practical tools, and compassionate support to help you understand, manage, and find relief from menstrual discomfort. Whether you need quick remedies, long-term strategies, or a deeper understanding of your body, we're here for you.
hero.imageAlt: A woman in a warm, caring environment expressing understanding and compassion

instantRelief.title: Instant Relief
instantRelief.description: Quick techniques and remedies to alleviate period pain when you need it most. Find methods you can use right now for immediate comfort.

interactiveSolutions.title: Interactive Solutions
interactiveSolutions.description: Engaging tools and personalized insights to help you manage your menstrual health proactively. Use our symptom checker and resources for tailored guidance.

dailyConditioning.title: Daily Conditioning
dailyConditioning.description: Lifestyle adjustments and routines to build long-term resilience against menstrual discomfort and support overall wellness throughout your cycle.

articlesPage.title: Articles & Guides
articlesPage.description: Explore our collection of articles to learn more about menstrual health and pain relief.

articleList.noArticles: No articles found. Check back soon!

therapiesPage.title: Relief Therapies
therapiesPage.description: Discover various therapies and methods to manage and alleviate period pain.

therapyList.noTherapies: No therapies found. Check back soon!

therapyDetail.notFoundDescription: Sorry, we could not find the therapy you are looking for.

immediateReliefPage.title: Immediate Relief Solutions for Period Pain
immediateReliefPage.description: Explore quick and effective methods to find relief from period pain when you need it most. Learn about techniques you can apply right now.
immediateReliefPage.introText: When period pain strikes, you need fast, effective ways to find comfort. This section is dedicated to immediate relief solutions ‚Äì methods you can turn to right now to help alleviate acute menstrual cramps and discomfort.
immediateReliefPage.findingWhatWorksText: Experimentation is key to discovering which immediate relief methods are most effective for your unique body and pain type. Consider combining different approaches for enhanced comfort.

naturalTherapiesPage.title: Natural Therapies & Daily Conditioning for Menstrual Wellness
naturalTherapiesPage.description: Discover gentle, natural approaches and lifestyle adjustments for long-term menstrual wellness and reducing pain.
naturalTherapiesPage.introText: Beyond immediate relief, cultivating long-term menstrual wellness involves integrating natural therapies and mindful daily habits into your routine. This section explores holistic approaches that can help reduce the frequency and severity of period pain over time and support your overall well-being throughout your cycle.
naturalTherapiesPage.consistencyIsKeyText: Integrating these natural approaches takes time and consistency. Be patient with yourself and focus on building sustainable habits that support your body throughout your entire cycle, not just during your period.

culturalCharmsPage.title: Exploring Cultural Comfort: Charms and Traditional Healing Symbols
culturalCharmsPage.description: Explore the historical and cultural significance of charms, symbols, and traditional practices used for comfort and spiritual support.
culturalCharmsPage.introText: Throughout history and across diverse cultures, people have turned to symbols, objects, and traditional practices for comfort, protection, and support during times of vulnerability, including during menstruation. These practices are deeply rooted in cultural belief systems and folklore.
culturalCharmsPage.understandingText: Many cultures have traditions that involve using specific items or performing certain rituals believed to influence well-being, bring good fortune, or ward off negative energy. For some, this extends to seeking comfort or relief during challenging physical experiences like menstrual discomfort.
culturalCharmsPage.disclaimerText: The information presented here regarding cultural charms, traditional practices, and associated beliefs is for cultural and informational purposes only. These practices are rooted in tradition and belief systems and are not intended to be, and should not be interpreted as, a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.
culturalCharmsPage.introduction: Throughout history and across diverse cultures, people have turned to symbols, objects, and traditional practices for comfort, protection, and support during times of vulnerability, including during menstruation. These practices are deeply rooted in cultural belief systems and folklore.
culturalCharmsPage.contentSection1Description: Explore various traditional symbols and objects used across cultures for comfort and spiritual support.

interactiveToolsPage.title: Interactive Tools for Menstrual Health Management
interactiveToolsPage.description: Use our interactive tools to better understand your symptoms, track your pain patterns, and receive personalized recommendations.

symptomAssessment.title: Symptom Assessment Tool
symptomAssessment.description: Answer a few questions about your symptoms to receive personalized recommendations for managing your menstrual pain.

questions.painLocation: Where do you feel pain during your period?
questions.painIntensity: How would you rate your pain intensity?
questions.painDuration: How long does your pain typically last?
questions.accompaniedSymptoms: Which symptoms accompany your menstrual pain?
questions.reliefMethods: Which methods have you tried for relief?

results.title: Your Personalized Recommendations
results.disclaimer: These recommendations are based on your responses and are for informational purposes only. They are not a substitute for professional medical advice.

periodPainAssessment.title: Period Pain Assessment Tool
periodPainAssessment.description: Answer a few simple questions to understand your period pain type and severity, and get personalized health recommendations.

tool.title: Period Pain Assessment Tool
tool.subtitle: Answer a few simple questions to understand your period pain type and severity.
tool.intensityQuestion: How intense is your period pain?

intensityOptions.severe: Severe (completely affects daily activities, requires rest)

tool.onsetQuestion: When did your period pain start?
tool.symptomsQuestion: Do you have any of the following symptoms? (Multiple choice)

symptoms.bleeding: Abnormal bleeding (heavy flow or large clots)
symptoms.nonMenstrual: Pelvic pain even when not menstruating

tool.assessButton: Assess if Medical Care is Needed
tool.disclaimer: ‚ö†Ô∏è This tool is for reference only and cannot replace professional medical diagnosis. If you have concerns, please consult a doctor.

result.consultAdvice: We recommend consulting a doctor or gynecologist as soon as possible for professional medical advice and treatment options.
result.validationMessage: Please select pain intensity and onset time first

assessments.severe_symptoms: Based on the symptoms you selected (such as fever, severe vomiting, fainting, or abnormal bleeding), we recommend consulting a doctor immediately as these may be warning signs requiring medical evaluation.
assessments.severe_late: Severe period pain that starts years after menarche may indicate secondary dysmenorrhea. We recommend consulting a doctor to rule out potential gynecological issues.
assessments.severe_early: Your period pain is quite severe. While it may be primary dysmenorrhea, severe pain affecting daily life warrants medical evaluation for effective pain management.
assessments.moderate_late: Moderate period pain starting years after menarche warrants consulting a doctor to rule out secondary dysmenorrhea.
assessments.normal: Based on the information you provided, your period pain appears to be within the common range and may be primary dysmenorrhea. We recommend trying natural relief methods such as heat therapy, light exercise, and healthy dietary habits. If symptoms worsen or become abnormal, please consult a doctor promptly.

breathingExercise.title: 4-7-8 Breathing Exercise
breathingExercise.subtitle: Natural pain relief through nervous system regulation
breathingExercise.tip: üí° Tip: Find a comfortable sitting or lying position, relax all muscles. Beginners should do 3-4 cycles.

precautions.title: Precautions:
items: Find comfortable sitting or lying position

results.mild: Your menstrual pain is mild. You can try natural relief methods like heat therapy and light exercise.
results.moderate: Your menstrual pain is moderate. Consider combining multiple relief methods, and over-the-counter pain medication if needed.
results.severe: Your menstrual pain is severe. We recommend consulting a doctor for professional assessment and treatment advice.

constitutionTest.subtitle: Discover your TCM constitution type through professional questionnaire and get personalized health recommendations

instructions.title: Test Instructions
instructions.item1: Answer based on your condition in the past 3 months
instructions.item2: Choose the option that best describes you
instructions.item3: If unsure, choose the relatively more suitable option
instructions.item4: Results are for reference only, not medical diagnosis

lifestyle.title: Scenario-based Lifestyle Recommendations
lifestyle.description: Based on your constitution type, here are personalized recommendations for different life scenarios
lifestyle.reminderText: These recommendations require consistent practice to see results. It's recommended to combine with professional medical guidance.

messages.testCompleteDesc: Your personalized constitution analysis has been generated
messages.testFailedDesc: Unable to generate test results, please try again

emergencyKit.title: Personalized Emergency Kit Recommendations
emergencyKit.description: Based on your constitution characteristics, we recommend a personalized emergency kit item list. Be prepared for a more comfortable period.
emergencyKit.packingAdvice: Prioritize "Essential" items, choose "Recommended" and "Optional" items based on outing duration and scenarios. Consider preparing a dedicated small bag for easy access.

communication.title: Communication Template Assistant
communication.description: Communication with people around you is important when experiencing menstrual discomfort. These templates can help you better express your needs and seek understanding.
communication.usageAdvice: These templates are for reference only. Please adjust them according to your actual situation and relationship intimacy. Sincere communication is key to building understanding.

scenarioSolutionsPage.title: Scenario-Based Solutions
scenarioSolutionsPage.description: Professional menstrual pain management strategies tailored for different life situations, helping you stay confident in any environment.
scenarioSolutionsPage.introText: Every woman's life is multifaceted, from workplace to home, from exercise to social activities. Different scenarios require different coping strategies. We've carefully prepared comprehensive scenario-based solutions to help you handle menstrual discomfort gracefully, wherever you are.

office.title: Office/Workplace Scenarios
office.description: Discreet relief solutions for professional environments

commute.title: Commuting Scenarios
commute.description: Strategies for sudden pain while traveling

footer.disclaimer: This content is for informational purposes only and should not replace professional medical advice.
footer.medicalDisclaimerFull: Medical Disclaimer: The content on this website is for informational and educational purposes only and is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. We are not healthcare professionals. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition. In case of emergency, seek immediate medical attention. Use of this website does not establish a doctor-patient relationship.

userSuccessStories.title: User Success Stories
userSuccessStories.statistic: Over 10,000+ women have found their own solutions here
userSuccessStories.ctaButton: Join them and start your healing journey

story1.name: Lisa Li
story1.testimonial: "Through personalized assessment, I discovered I have prostaglandin-excess type dysmenorrhea. Following the platform's dietary and exercise recommendations, my pain intensity dropped from 8 to 3 points in 3 months, and my work efficiency improved significantly!"

story2.name: Tina Zhang
story2.testimonial: "The teen section content is so helpful! I learned heat therapy, yoga, and breathing techniques. Now I'm not afraid of getting my period during exams. I even helped my roommates improve, and our relationships got better!"

story3.name: Wendy Wang
story3.testimonial: "The pain diary feature helped me discover the connection between menstrual pain and stress. Combined with doctor's treatment and platform recommendations, I've basically said goodbye to monthly suffering, and my quality of life has improved significantly."

breathingExercise.title: 4-7-8 Breathing Exercise
breathingExercise.description: Based on scientifically validated 4-7-8 breathing method, quickly relieve pain through nervous system regulation. No download required, start practicing immediately.

precautions.title: Precautions:
items: Find comfortable sitting or lying position
